October 2012.event: The SEO expressed grave concern over the situation in Deiz ez-Zor city, where unrelenting airstrikes and military blockades for 130 days have destroyed 75% of the city and killed over 3,000 people. According to the organization, " on 20 October it was reported that a gruesome massacre of over 80 civilians in Deir ez-Zor was perpetrated by the Assad government in which men, women, and children were tortured, slaughtered, and burned. The massacre took place at the southern edge of the city, where government forces have been staging attacks for months."

November 2012.event: On 2 November, Syrian government forces are said to have left the town of Saraqib. This town is 50 kilometres (31 mi) south-west of Aleppo and is at the junction of the road from the Mediterranean of Latakia and the M5 highway that runs from Damascus to Aleppo. If confirmed, the Syrian government will be forced to resupply its forces in Aleppo using smaller rural roads or by air since it lost Maarrat al-Nu'man on October 10.

refs.text: Syrian government forces quit town linking Aleppo to south: monitor 2 November 2012
Syria Airstrikes Target Strategic Northern City Of Maaret Al Numan 31 October 2012

November 2012.event: Alternatively, the SOHR reported the deaths of over 200; 74 civilians (10 children), 55 rebels (including a defected lieutenant) & 61 soldiers. In addition, 2 were killed due to bombardment in Aleppo, 43 unidentified corpses were found, and dozens were slain due to mutual bombardment in Harem.

Five rebel units have launched a coordinated attack on the Taftanaz airbase supported by mortars and rocket fire. The attack appears aimed at not raiding the airbase (as they have done previously with others) but to occupy the airbase permanently as to prevent its further use. The base is just 15 kilometres (9.3 mi) from the town of Saraqib, which fell to the rebels less than two days ago.

refs.text: Syria conflict: Rebels 'attack key airbase at Taftanaz' 3 November 2012

refs.text: Syrian president vows to 'live and die' in Syria, threatens against foreign invasion - CNN.com

November 2012.event: On 10 November twin suicide car bomb attacks struck the Syrian Army Officers' Club in Daraa, killing at least 20 soldiers. SANA also reported the attack but did not mention casualties.

refs.text: Syria opposition considers unity amid reports of government airstrikes, rebel car bombs November 10, 2012
Car bombers kill Syrian security men in Deraa: activists 10 November 2012

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 147 civilians killed, including 47 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: Israel has fired warning shots at Syria, after a mortar round hit an Israel Defense Forces outpost, for the first time since the 1973 Yom Kippur War.

refs.text: Israel fires warning shots into Syria: army 11 November 2012

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 90 civilians killed, including 35 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 11-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: Stray mortar shells again hit an IDF post on the Golan Heights, in response Israeli tanks returned fire scoring a 'direct hit' on the source of the fire. Israeli minister of strategic affairs, Moshe Yaalon, stated that he did not believe that these incidents were deliberate but an accidental overspill of fighting from the Syrian civil war. Israeli media reported at least two Syrian casualties.

refs.text: Israel hits Syrian mortar that fired on Golan 13 November 2012

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 155 people killed, including 50 in the Damascus suburbs. A government helicopter was shot down by rebels at Hamdan Military Airport. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 12-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 172 people killed, including 109 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 13-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: The SOHR reported the deaths of around 205 Syrians slain. 99 (including 17 children) civilians were slain, 47 in the Damascus Suburbs. 55 rebels were killed, including a commander in Quneitra & 22 in the Damascus Suburbs. 49 soldiers were killed.
The LCC reported 100 people killed, including 37 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 14-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 130 people killed, including 59 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 15-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: SOHR reported the deaths of around 141 Syrians. 72 civilians (12 children) were killed, including 27 in the Damascus Suburbs. 40 rebels were killed, including a commander in Aleppo. 32 soldiers were also killed.
The LCC reported 122 people killed, including 35 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 136 people killed, including 63 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 17-11-212 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: One General and 12 other officers defected from the Syrian army and crossed the border into Turkey, they were among 53 people who also included defecting soldiers and their families.

refs.text: A Syrian general and a dozen other officers defected with their families to Turkey on Friday. - Al Jazeera Blogs

November 2012.event: A Turkish journalist held for three months by the Syrian Government was freed and sent back to Turkey, his Jordanian colleague is still missing.

refs.text: Captured Turkish journalist released in Syria - Al Jazeera Blogs

November 2012.event: Rebels captured a military airport near rebel-held Abu Kamal, meaning that the only air base the Syrian Government holds in the Deiz ez zor region is the main one near Deiz ez zor city.

refs.text: Syrian rebels 'seize airport near Iraq' - Middle East

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 78 people killed, including 26 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 18-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

refs.text: Syria Today 20-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 95 people killed, including 35 in Aleppo and 29 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 21-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: Rebels captured an army base in Mayadin east of Deir ez-Zor. It means that the whole region, from the Iraqi border along the Euphrates to Deir ez-Zor is now under rebel control.

refs.text: Rebels capture key base in Syria's east - Middle East

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 151 civilians killed, including 66 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 76 civilians killed, including 30 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 23-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 82 civilians killed, including 35 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 24-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: Rebels and protestors launched an attack on an airbase, 15 kilometers outside Damascus, of which they say to control a "large part" of. In the attack they also said to have destroyed two helicopters on the ground.

refs.text: Rebels seize "large part" of army airport near Damascus, NGO says November 25, 2012

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 117 civilians killed, including 55 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 25-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: Rebel fighters overran government defenses and captured the Tishrin Dam, near the town of Manbij. The dam supplies several areas of Syria with electricity.

refs.text: Syria Crisis: Tishrin Dam Seized By Syrian Rebels Near Manbij

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 168 civilians killed, including 90 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 26-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 131 civilians killed, including 48 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 27-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: A Syrian Air Force Mi-8 helicopter was downed after being hit by an apparent missile launched by Syrian rebels. According to experts, it appeared to be MANPADS.

refs.text: Videos From Syria Appear to Show First Confirmed Hit of Aircraft by Surface-to-Air Missile
Syrian rebels 'shoot down army helicopter'
Helicopter shot down as Syria air war intensifies

November 2012.event: Twin car bombs ripped through Jaramana, a Damascus suburb, killing at least 34 people and leaving dozens critically wounded, according to state media and hospital officials. The area is populated mostly by Christians and Druze.

refs.text: Syria: Twin car bombs in Damascus kill 34 people
Syria conflict: Twin bomb blasts shake Damascus suburb

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 160 civilians killed, including 96 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 28-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: The Syrian government was the only government to use anti-personal mines in 2012 and the only government to lay any new minefields.

refs.text: Syria only state using landmines in 2012, campaigners say 29 November 2012

November 2012.event: There were reports that there was fighting near the airport in Damascus, closing the road to the airport.

refs.text: Syrian rebels battling for airport amid Internet shutdown

November 2012.event: The Dubai-based Emirates airline suspended flights to the Syrian capital due to the fighting. A plane from Egypt had landed in Damascus as scheduled, and passengers were safe but the pilot was ordered to take off back to Cairo without passengers if he felt the situation was too bad to stay longer.

refs.text: Damascus fighting cuts off Internet, airport

November 2012.event: The internet was effectively shut down in the entire country for unknown reasons, according to internet monitoring firms.

refs.text: Syria: Internet and mobile communication 'cut off'
77 networks out in Syria

November 2012.event: Rebels are said to have obtained up to 40 shoulder-launched surface-to-air missiles MANPADS according to US and Middle Eastern intelligent officials. Some of these missiles were supplied by Qatar.

refs.text: Syrian rebels have new anti-aircraft missile systems, report says 29 November 2012

November 2012.event: Some other missiles have been looted from the Syrian Army including, possibly, the more advanced SA-16 other than generic SA-7.

refs.text: Syrian rebels muster new air power November 30, 2012 12:00AM

November 2012.event: State media is reporting that the rebels have been pushed back from the road to the Damascus International Airport and that they have started burning nearby orchards in order to drive the rebels out.

refs.text: Damascus’ airport road "secured" after army intervention, state TV says November 29, 2012

November 2012.event: In relation to the cut off of the internet across Syria, the non lethal aid supplied by the US to the rebels included 2,000 communication kits. These kits are designed to operate outside of Syrian internet infrastructure likewise the Syrian government forces are unlikely to be affected as they have their own radios, meaning that the biggest people affected are civilian users. Those with satellite phones are also unaffected. It is common practice for government forces to cut off communications, such as the internet, prior to an offensive such as occurred in Egypt during 2011.

refs.text: Syria's internet cut off amid increased fighting Friday, November 30, 2012

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 96 civilians killed, including 51 in Aleppo. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 29-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria

November 2012.event: At least 12 Lebanese militants were killed in a Syrian army ambush near the town of Talkalakh.
SOHR said 30 Lebanese militants had gone missing and a security source told Reuters that they were accompanied by nine Syrians as well as Libyans, Egyptians and Yemenis.

refs.text: Lebanese gunmen killed by Syrian army: sources

November 2012.event: Rebels have claimed to have destroyed three Syrian army tanks in fighting near the Damascus International Airport.

refs.text: Latest Syria Developments 30 November 2012

November 2012.event: Given the ongoing cut to the internet in Syria, Google and Twitter have reactivated their voice to tweet program. This allows a person with a phone connection to send tweets by speaking into their phone. The system was developed for use during protests in Egypt when the Egyptian government cut off the internet for several days last year.

refs.text: Google and Twitter intervene in Syrian blackout 1 December 2012

November 2012.event: The LCC reported 138 civilians killed, including 70 in the Damascus suburbs. They neglected to report the death of any of the Syrian Army.

refs.text: Syria Today 30-11-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria
